page.title: 18DOULTING STONE.(TWO)
page.content: Doulting Stone is like the famous{Bath {Stone}but is much better. There are three kinds of Stone: the fine grained stone, the coarse grained stone which is better and{Doulting Grey}which is the best of all three. Unfortunately there isn't enough grey stone to make it worth quarrying. They can't use explosives because that would break the stone into pieces too small for building. Instead they use a Sampson Electric Saw, pneumatic drills and a crane to lift the saw and stone. It can take anything from 30 minutes to a whole day depending on the size of the stone. The men can tell if it is a good piece of stone by hitting it with hammer: if there is a ringing sound it is a good piece. It is used in buildings and has already been used in {Wells, Bristol and Exeter Cathedrals and lots of{churches}in England.
